It is an era of mythical times, and power struggles within great sects in nations while you, Xio Dan are living in a remote peaceful village along with your friends and your best friend Yan Hong. As kids who barely turned 10, you and your friends are playing in the village fields to your hearts content. After a long day of joy, you and your friends bid goodbyes and scattered to your homes.
After dark night hits the village you feel an ominous pressure that wakes you up.
You mutter in confusion at the sight of an old monk-like figure near a tree. As you cautiously draw closer, he suddenly grabs you and hurries away. Glancing back, you spot a pursuer, intent on harm. With a powerful outburst of yellow magic, the monk illuminates the village, thwarting the attacker and escaping with you to a nearby shrine.
Drowsy, your parents dismiss your concern and urge you to return to sleep. Curiosity leads you to peek outside, but you spot nothing amiss. Emboldened by adventure, you venture out and are suddenly blinded by a bright light. Before you can react, a shadowy figure knocks you out. The next thing you know, you awaken in the village shrine beside your friend Yan. Confused, you rouse him, and together you return to the village to find chaos: villagers murdered, homes ablaze, and structures crumbling. A stranger intervenes, covering your eyes and urging you both to follow him to his sect for sanctuary.
The monk chuckles at the innocent request, unaware of the unfolding events. While agrees readily and imprints the technique onto you and explaining magic flow, his attention abruptly draws to a commotion above. Descending from the sky, a menacing figure demands something from the monk, holding Yan captive.
Recognizing the danger, the monk shields you and initiates a deceptive magic burst to rescue Yan. In the ensuing struggle, the monk prevails but sustains severe injuries. He entrusts you with a relic, the "Blood Pearl," urging caution until you find its counterpart, the Staff of Purity. With a final warning, he fades into the shadows.
Overwhelmed by the magics imprint, you collapse beside Yan and wake up the following morning. You rouse Yan, and together you return to the village to find chaos: villagers murdered, homes ablaze, and structures crumbling. A stranger intervenes, covering your eyes and urging you both to follow him to his sect for sanctuary.
The monk pulls you back with magic and thrusts a relic into your hands, its weight heavy with unspoken significance. His attention abruptly draws to a commotion above. Descending from the sky, a menacing figure demands something from the monk, holding Yan captive.
After talking with the mysterious man, you and Yan decide that he is trustworthy, and it is best to go with him.
You and Yan decides to trust the mysterious man and accepts his offer to join his sect, the Truth Path Sect. You are given the chance to select a sect within the Truth Path Sect to begin training and become one of their own.
Cautious after recent events, you decline the offer to join the mysterious mans sect. Opting to explore with Yan, you seek answers about the village attack and the Blood Pearls significance.
Rather than hastily accepting or declining, you inquire further about the mysterious mans sect and their motives. As you converse, you evaluate his trustworthiness and weigh the potential benefits for you and Yan. Depending on his responses, you will determine whether to join or decline the offer.
The Hidden Bamboo Sect, nestled in a tranquil, remote area reminiscent of your home, boasts friendly and cooperative disciples. Though the sect leader and head disciple lack renown, their kindness and warmth compensate for it. The Water Mist Sect is known for its strictness and ambition, housing competitive disciples who consistently excel in tournaments. Led by a strict sect master and a driven head disciple, their focus lies on power and ambition.
A man had attacked the village at night. 7 Years have passed... Without help and lack of experience you were unable to find the Staff of Purity Disciples from all sects within the Truth Path prepare for a tournament. Its your and Yans first real battle. Despite warnings, you train deep in the woods and are pulled into a river where you drown. Echoes of the monks words haunt you as you sink, mentioning the "Staff of Purity." The Blood Pearl merges with a strange staff at the rivers bottom. Awakening beside the merged staff, you realize its the Staff of Purity, and the tournament is today. As disciples of all sects within the Truth Path prepare for a tournament, you and Yan gear up for your first real battle. Restricted to the sect grounds by strict rules, you have failed to seek out the Staff of Purity, the counterpart to your relic, and are compelled to enter the tournament wielding a sword. End of Chapter I...
